snippet: The May Day gatherings were intended to show Congress that momentum is building in favor of a path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants in the country illegally.
abstract: Tens of thousands of immigrants, Latinos and other supporters of immigration system overhaul turn out for May Day demonstrations intended to show Congress that momentum is building for path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants in country illegally.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sarah Garrecht Gassen from Tucson; Rebecca D’Angelo from Richmond, Va.; Rebecca Fairley Raney from Los Angeles; and Steven Yaccino from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: The May Day gatherings were intended to show Congress that momentum is building in favor of a path to citizenship for 11 million immigrants in the country illegally.

headline.main: Showing Grass-Roots Support for Immigration Overhaul
headline.print_headline: Showing Grass-Roots Support for Immigration Overhaul
